summary: An FBI 302 form documenting the January 13, 2021, video interview of a witness, identified as [REDACTED], regarding his knowledge of Jeffrey Epstein's activities in Palm Beach. The witness describes how his then-girlfriend, [REDACTED], was recruited for massages, the role of Ghislaine Maxwell, the recruitment of other underage girls, financial payments, and sexual acts. The interview also covers interactions with Epstein's lawyers and the witness's own brief encounter with Epstein in jail.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the investigation. The witness met him once at his Palm Beach home and describes his recruitment of underage girls for massages that escalated to sexual acts, his 'flashy' demeanor, and his properties.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by the witness's girlfriend as an aggressive, rude, and nasty woman who was present at Epstein's home, supposed to be a massage teacher, and made the girlfriend uncomfortable.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned as a famous person Epstein knew; the witness was shown a photo containing him.

persons.name: Michael Jackson
persons.context: Epstein had Jackson call the witness's girlfriend on her birthday as a gift.

connections.description: Maxwell was friends with Epstein and was supposed to teach girls what Epstein liked during massages, acting as a facilitator.
Epstein recruited the underage girlfriend for paid massages, which involved sexual acts. He gave her gifts and had Michael Jackson call her.
They were boyfriend and girlfriend at the time of the described events. He drove her to Epstein's home and they discussed the activities there.
The girlfriend was extremely bothered by Maxwell, who was aggressive and rude while supposedly teaching massage techniques at Epstein's home.
Epstein instructed [REDACTED] to start bringing friends to his home for massages, and she recruited other girls from her trailer park.
The witness met Epstein once at his home. Later, Epstein recognized and spoke to the witness when they were both in jail.

events.title: Witness's Visit to Epstein's Home
events.description: The witness and his girlfriend visited Jeffrey Epstein's home in Palm Beach. Epstein arrived in a convertible and was described as 'flashy'.

events.title: Recruitment of Witness's Girlfriend
events.description: The witness's girlfriend was recruited by [REDACTED] to massage an 'old guy' (Epstein) for $200. This marked the beginning of her involvement.

events.title: Jail Encounter with Epstein
events.description: The witness was in jail (stockade) at the same time as Jeffrey Epstein. Epstein called him over, asked if he remembered him, and gave his lawyers' card regarding lawsuits.

events.title: Girlfriend Leaves for Modeling
events.description: The witness's girlfriend, [REDACTED], was sent by Epstein to Paris to model and never returned.

events.title: FBI Interview of Witness
events.description: The witness was interviewed via video conference by the FBI, AUSAs, a detective, and an SA regarding his knowledge of Epstein's activities.

locations: El Brillo Way, Palm Beach (Epstein's home address)
keyFacts: The witness's underage girlfriend was recruited for paid massages at Epstein's home, which escalated to sexual acts including 'handjobs and blowjobs' performed by other girls.
Ghislaine Maxwell was described as an aggressive, rude presence at Epstein's home who was supposed to teach massage techniques, making the girlfriend uncomfortable.
Epstein and his associates were aware the girls were underage, as they discussed helping them with school and massage therapy.
Epstein used intermediaries like [REDACTED] to recruit girls from local trailer parks, paying $200-$300 per session, and the money was often used for drugs.
The witness had a later, brief encounter with Epstein in jail (stockade) around 2008, where Epstein gave him his lawyers' card regarding lawsuits from the girls.
